Headline: Dedicated my time to someone who doesn't deserve it: Neha on breakup
Content: ['', 'Singer Neha Kakkar, who recently broke up with actor Himansh Kohli, said, "I dedicated all my time and energy to that person who doesn\'t deserve it." "When I was in a relationship, I wasn\'t being able to give time to my family and...friends," she added. Neha further said with this bad experience, she is "not open to love again."', '', 'short by Daisy Mowke / ', '      11:23 am on 10 Feb', '']

Headline: Typed keywords like 'actors required' on Google for auditions: Kartik
Content: ['', 'Actor Kartik Aaryan has revealed that he used to type keywords like \'actors required\' and \'casting call\' on Google and Facebook to look for auditions as he didn\'t know anyone. "I think social media has helped me out to become an actor," he added. Kartik further revealed he faced many rejections at auditions and was told he is "not fit".', '', 'short by Daisy Mowke / ', '      09:07 am on 10 Feb', '']

Headline: Proud of you big bro: Hardik after Krunal named Man of the Match
Content: ['', 'After Team India all-rounder Krunal Pandya was named Man of the Match in the second T20I against New Zealand, his brother Hardik took to social media to share a picture of the duo. "Proud of you big bro, Krunal," he captioned the picture. The 27-year-old left-arm spinner produced bowling figures of 4-0-28-3 to help India equalise the three-match series 1-1.', '', 'short by Anmol Sharma / ', '      11:16 pm on 09 Feb', '']

Headline: Stokes recalled from dressing room after being dismissed on no-ball
Content: ['', 'England\'s Ben Stokes was recalled to bat from dressing room after being dismissed off a no-ball during the third Windies-England Test on Saturday. The 27-year-old was caught-and-bowled by Alzarri Joseph, and recalled soon after third umpire discovered Joseph had overstepped. Stokes benefitted from a rule allowing batsmen, who have walked off in "misapprehension" of being given out, to be recalled.', '', 'short by Anmol Sharma / ', '      12:45 pm on 10 Feb', '']

Headline: Man Utd register 10th win in 11 matches, move into PL top 4
Content: ['', 'Manchester United defeated Fulham 3-0 on Saturday to register their 10th victory in 11 Premier League matches. With this, United moved into the top four on Premier League points table. Midfielder Paul Pogba opened the scoring for United in the 14th minute and scored his second by converting a 65th-minute penalty, while forward Anthony Martial scored in the 23rd minute. ', '', 'short by Anmol Sharma / ', '      12:34 am on 10 Feb', '']

Headline: Rival fans make aeroplane gestures to mock Sala's death, arrested
Content: ['', "Two Southampton fans were arrested for mocking the death of 28-year-old Argentine footballer Emiliano Sala by making aeroplane gestures towards Cardiff City supporters during the teams' Premier League match on Saturday. It was Cardiff City's first match since Sala's death was confirmed on Thursday, over two weeks after his plane vanished. Sala was travelling from France to join Cardiff City.", '', 'short by Anmol Sharma / ', '      01:07 pm on 10 Feb', '']

Headline: ED questions Vadra 24 hours in 3 days over London property
Content: ['', 'Robert Vadra was questioned for eight hours by the Enforcement Directorate on Saturday for the third time in a week over a money laundering case. The businessman was questioned for six hours and ten hours on Wednesday and Thursday, respectively. Vadra had denied allegations of money laundering in the purchase of a London-based property worth £1.9 million (over ₹17 crore).', '', 'short by Gaurav Shroff / ', '      11:28 pm on 09 Feb', '']

Headline: Face recognition tech reunites MP teen with family after 8 months
Content: ['', "A 14-year-old mentally unsound boy from Madhya Pradesh was reunited with his family with the help of the Darpan Face Recognition Tool developed by Telangana police. The teenager had left his residence in Madhya Pradesh's Ujjain in June last year. He was traced at a government ashram in Bengaluru on December 25 last year, police said.", '', 'short by Ankush Verma / ', '      08:45 am on 10 Feb', '']

Headline: Pak PM's minorities remark egregious insult to our citizens: India
Content: ['', 'The Ministry of External Affairs (MEA) on Saturday called Pakistan PM Imran Khan\'s recent remarks about minorities in India "an egregious insult to all citizens of India". "India has eminent leaders of all faiths who occupy its highest Constitutional and official positions. In contrast, Pakistani citizens of non-Islamic faith are barred from occupying high Constitutional offices," MEA said.', '', 'short by Nandini Sinha / ', '      11:36 pm on 09 Feb', '']

Headline: UK Prince Philip gives up driving licence after crash injured women
Content: ['', "UK Queen Elizabeth II's 97-year-old husband Prince Philip has given up his driving licence over three weeks after his car overturned following a collision with another vehicle. Two women in the other car, which also had a nine-month-old, suffered injuries. There's no legal age in Britain to stop driving, but drivers over 70 must renew their licences every three years.", '', 'short by Ankush Verma / ', '      09:23 am on 10 Feb', '']

Headline: Pakistani journalist critical of government seized outside home
Content: ['', 'Rizwan Razi, a Pakistani journalist critical of the government was seized outside his home, his son said. Pakistan\'s Federal Investigation Agency said he was being investigated for "obnoxious" comments about the judiciary, government and intelligence agencies on his Twitter account. Razi was arrested under the cybercrime law which is believed to give overreaching powers to law enforcement agencies.', '', 'short by Nandini Sinha / ', '      09:00 am on 10 Feb', '']

Headline: Canadian man given 8 life sentences for murdering, dismembering 8 men
Content: ['', 'A 67-year-old Canadian man who killed eight men in Toronto and dismembered their bodies has been given eight concurrent life sentences. He will not be eligible for parole until he is 91. Bruce McArthur\'s behaviour was described as "pure evil" by the court, which also said he would\'ve kept killing if he hadn\'t been apprehended by the police.', '', 'short by Ankush Verma / ', '      12:29 pm on 10 Feb', '']

Headline: Pregnant woman carries dying baby to term, donates organs after death
Content: ['', "Krysta Davis from US carried her baby to term to donate the organs, even after she was told the baby wouldn't live for more than 30 minutes after birth. Her to-be-born daughter was diagnosed with anencephaly, a rare condition. After the baby died, her heart valves were given to two children and her lungs were given to a research hospital.", '', 'short by Daisy Mowke / ', '      10:39 am on 10 Feb', '']

Headline: Non-film music reaching more people than film music: Kanungo
Content: ['', 'Speaking about new trends in the music industry, singer Arjun Kanungo said that \'non-film music\' is now reaching more people than \'film music\'. "I was one of the first few people to start this trend...it feels good to be a part of a wave that started this trend," Kanungo added. It\'s easier for independent artistes to succeed, he further said.', '', 'short by Rahel Philipose / ', '      11:47 pm on 09 Feb', '']

Headline: Fatima Sana Shaikh to star with Saif in 'Tantrik': Reports
Content: ['', "Actress Fatima Sana Shaikh will star in the upcoming horror comedy film 'Tantrik', which will also feature actor Saif Ali Khan in a lead role, as per reports. Saif was reportedly approached by the film's makers after Abhishek Bachchan turned down the role. The film will be directed by Pawan Kripalani, reports further suggested. ", '', 'short by Rahel Philipose / ', '      11:12 pm on 09 Feb', '']

Headline: Hackers using Google Translate to steal information: Report
Content: ['', "Hackers are exploiting a Google Translate loophole which enables hiding fake website addresses resembling genuine existing ones to steal user information, a report has claimed. The fake addresses are preceded by 'www.translate.google.com' making them appear legitimate, the report revealed. It added the trick isn't too effective on desktops as multiple signs may warn users that something is wrong.", '', 'short by Kanishka Pandey / ', '      08:00 am on 10 Feb', '']

Headline: Have video of K'taka CM demanding ₹25 cr bribe: BJP MLA
Content: ['', 'BJP MLA Arvind Limbavali on Saturday claimed that BJP has a videotape where Karnataka CM HD Kumaraswamy can be seen demanding ₹25 crore from an aspirant for Member of Legislative Council\u200b (MLC) seat. He further stated that the video will be released on Monday. This comes after Kumaraswamy released audio recordings, claiming it proved poaching of JD(S) MLA by BJP.', '', 'short by Nikita Pradhan / ', '      12:34 pm on 10 Feb', '']

Headline: Free electricity to Haryana farmers if we win: Sukhbir Badal
Content: ['', "Shiromani Akali Dal (SAD) chief Sukhbir Singh Badal has said that if SAD is voted to power in Haryana Assembly elections, it will provide free electricity to farmers. He added the party will ensure 100% water supply and sewerage system in Haryana. He further urged people to create awareness about SAD's social welfare initiatives in the state. ", '', 'short by Shweta Singh / ', '      11:39 pm on 09 Feb', '']

Headline: It seems an Olympics is going on to deride me: PM Modi
Content: ['', 'Talking about the Opposition, PM Narendra Modi on Saturday said, "It is as if an Olympics is on to deride Modi." "The job of \'Mahamilawatwalas\' is only to heap abuses and more abuses on Modi," he added. He further said that the Opposition leaders are only involved in "holding each other\'s hands in meetings in Delhi and Kolkata for photographs".', '', 'short by Nikita Pradhan / ', '      11:54 am on 10 Feb', '']

Headline: Gandhi family has made corruption a 'sanskar': Smriti Irani
Content: ['', 'Taking a dig at Congress President Rahul Gandhi\'s brother-in-law Robert Vadra, Union Minister Smriti Irani on Saturday said, "The Gandhi family has made corruption a \'sanskar\'." "Such shameless gestures cannot be done by any other person," she added. This comes after Vadra was questioned for the third time this week by the Enforcement Directorate over allegations of money laundering.', '', 'short by Nikita Pradhan / ', '      12:00 pm on 10 Feb', '']

Headline: Meghalaya CM threatens to quit NDA over Citizenship Bill
Content: ['', "Meghalaya CM Conrad Sangma on Saturday said that National People's Party (NPP) will break ties with NDA if the Citizenship (Amendment) Bill is passed in the Rajya Sabha. He added that a resolution has been passed in this regard which will be submitted to the Narendra Modi government. The Bill was passed in Lok Sabha on January 8.", '', 'short by Nikita Pradhan / ', '      11:58 am on 10 Feb', '']

Headline: Bengaluru may get e-vehicle charging pods across 10 metro stops
Content: ['', "Karnataka 2019 Budget has proposed charging stations for Electric Vehicles (EV) across 10 metro stations in Bengaluru, as part of the state government’s comprehensive mobility scheme. Bangalore Metropolitan Transport Corporation (BMTC) has been allocated ₹50 crore to implement the scheme. The state had announced five-year 'Karnataka Electric Vehicle & Energy Storage Policy' in September 2017.", '', 'short by Kanishka Pandey / ', '      11:21 pm on 09 Feb', '']

Headline: ED files money laundering case against Hafiz Saeed's charity
Content: ['', "The Enforcement Directorate has registered a case of money laundering against 26/11 Mumbai attack mastermind Hafiz Saeed-led charity, the Falah-e-Insaniat Foundation (FIF). ED's case is based on an FIR registered by NIA, which last year arrested Mohammad Salman. He allegedly received funds from FIF operators through hawala channels to carry out terrorist activities and to create unrest in India. ", '', 'short by Nandini Sinha / ', '      12:05 am on 10 Feb', '']

Headline: BMC inaugurates first underground garbage bins in Mumbai
Content: ['', 'The Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) on Friday inaugurated the first underground garbage bins in Mumbai. Costing ₹8 lakh each, the bins have separate provisions for wet and dry waste. The underground garbage bins will be emptied on a daily basis using a hydraulic jack connected to the garbage truck, a BMC official said. ', '', 'short by Shweta Singh / ', '      11:50 pm on 09 Feb', '']

Headline: Not ousting nuns over rape protest: Jalandhar Diocese Administrator
Content: ['', 'Current Apostolic Administrator of Jalandhar Diocese, Bishop Agnelo, in an email said that there will be no move to oust the five Kerala nuns who protested against rape-accused Bishop Franco Mulakkal. He added that the transfer orders would stand revoked as long as the case was in court. Four of the nuns were earlier asked to leave the Kuravilangad convent.', '', 'short by Nikita Pradhan / ', '      12:28 pm on 10 Feb', '']
